pages.title: Sways
pages.text: Simply speaking, {b Sways} are potion effects that wait to be activated. By adjusting the properties of a beverage, one or more Sways can be activated as effects that the beverage provides. Please refer to {(beverages_basics/sway_list)this page} for a comprehensive list of sways.

pages.title: Relish Requirements
pages.text: A Sway is usually bound to a specific {(beverages_basics/relishes)Relish}, meaning that a beverage is qualified to active certain Sways only if it has the required Relish(es).

pages.title: Taste Requirements
pages.text: Also, a Sway is typically anchored to a fixed range of {(beverages_basics/tastes)Taste} values. In most cases, the level or duration of the effect that a Sway offers will {b increase} if the Tastes that meet the requirements {b go more intense}.

pages.title: Semi-Taste Patterns
pages.text: The Taste requirements of a Sway can often be broken down into two pairs of {b Semi-Taste} requirements, describing what pattern of two Semi-Taste values should be in to activate the Sway.
A {b blend} of two Semi-Tastes requires at least one of them to be intense enough. Furthermore, the resulting effect can be much stronger if both of the Semi-Tastes are intense.
A {b balancing} pattern of two Semi-Tastes requires the intensity of them be at roughly the same level and intense enough.
A {b contradicting} pattern of two Semi-Tastes requires only one of them to be intense enough, while the other to be as negligible as possible (but not absent).
A {b waning–waxing} pattern of two Semi-Tastes requires the intensity of them to be different enough. The more different be the intensity, the stronger be the effect.
A {b mixture} of two Tastes (not Semi-Tastes) has the effect areas scattered throughout the combinations of the tastes. There lies much possibility.
